text:
Sorry, I haven't
being paying close attention to the issue. Do you know how much space is
required on the WinRE volume? If so, it's pretty easy to do. (Mount the volume
in Windows, check the amount of space, unmount the volume, generate a report.)

metadata.subject: RE: [patchmanagement] You may hit a 0x80070643 - ERROR_INSTALL_FAILURE
metadata.email_text_original:
[You don't often get email from michael@smithcons.com. Learn why this is
important at https://aka.ms/LearnAboutSenderIdentification ] Sorry, I haven't
being paying close attention to the issue. Do you know how much space is
required on the WinRE volume? If so, it's pretty easy to do. (Mount the volume
in Windows, check the amount of space, unmount the volume, generate a report.)
-----Original Message----- From: 'Susan Bradley' via PatchManagement Sent:
Wednesday, January 10, 2024 4:31 PM To: patchmanagement@googlegroups.com
Subject: Re: [patchmanagement] You may hit a 0x80070643 - ERROR_INSTALL_FAILURE
I am not a scripter/powershell person. Is there an easy way to run a script to
determine if someone is going to hit this issue? I don't want to run through the
shrink script, I want to know if there is enough room that the patch won't fail?
Link: None
metadata.evaluated_noun_chunks: ['close attention', 'the issue', 'how much space', 'the WinRE volume']
